io.github.woodenbell.blix

Class HttpResponse

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.woodenbell.blix.HttpResponse

  • public class HttpResponse
extends java.lang.Object
    The class representing the HTTPResponse to the client, used to write the response and send the headers and status code.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HttpResponse(java.net.Socket client)
      The HTTP response constructor internally used to create a response object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void endHeaders()
      Ends the headers and starts the response body.
      void endResponse()
      Ends the response, closing the the OutputStream that was being used to write the response.
      void sendHeader(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String val)
      Sends the header field and value.
      void sendResponse(int code, java.lang.String msg)
      Sends the status code followed by a message.
      void write(java.lang.String data)
      Writes to the response body.
      void writeBytes(byte[] data)
      Writes to the response body.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpResponse

        public HttpResponse(java.net.Socket client)
        The HTTP response constructor internally used to create a response object.
        Parameters:
        client - The client socket that will have it's OutputStream used to write responses.

    • Method Detail

      • sendResponse

        public void sendResponse(int code,
                         java.lang.String msg)
        Sends the status code followed by a message.
        Parameters:
        code - The HTTP status code of the response.
        msg - The message of the HTTP status code.
        See Also:
        HTTP Status Codes

                       java.lang.String val)
        Sends the header field and value.

      • write

        public void write(java.lang.String data)
        Writes to the response body.
        Parameters:

      • writeBytes

        public void writeBytes(byte[] data)
        Writes to the response body.
        Parameters:
        data - The byte array that will be written in the response body.

      • endResponse

        public void endResponse()
        Ends the response, closing the the OutputStream that was being used to write the response.
